content: Is there an online interpreter or shell similar to http://codepad.org/ or http://www.trypython.org/ that supports Python 3?

Yes, there are several online interpreters and shells that support Python 3. Here are a few options you can explore:

1. **Repl.it**: [replit.com](https://replit.com/). It offers an interactive coding environment supporting multiple languages, including Python 3. You can write, run, and share code easily.

2. **Google Colab**: [colab.research.google.com](https://colab.research.google.com/). It's a free Jupyter notebook environment that runs in the cloud and supports Python 3. It's particularly popular for data science and machine learning tasks.

3. **PythonAnywhere**: [pythonanywhere.com](https://www.pythonanywhere.com/). This platform offers an online Python environment where you can run Python 3 code. It is great for web development and scripting.

4. **Jupyter Notebook**: [jupyter.org/try](https://jupyter.org/try). While traditionally installed locally, there are online platforms that host Jupyter Notebooks, allowing you to run Python 3 code in an interactive notebook format.

5. **Programiz**: [programiz.com/python-programming/online-compiler/](https://www.programiz.com/python-programming/online-compiler/). This is a straightforward online compiler for Python 3 code.

6. **SoloLearn**: [sololearn.com/CodingGround](https://www.sololearn.com/CodingGround). Offers a simple online editor for running Python 3 code snippets.

These platforms provide a variety of features, from simple code execution to full-fledged development environments with collaboration tools, so you can choose one based on your specific needs.
